content.headline: How Exercise Benefits You and Your Baby
content.intro: Regular physical activity during pregnancy offers numerous health advantages for both mother and baby. From reducing pregnancy discomforts to preparing your body for labor, exercise plays a crucial role in supporting a healthy pregnancy journey.

sections.title: Maternal Benefits of Exercise
sections.content: Exercise supports your physical and mental wellbeing throughout pregnancy:
points: Reduces back pain and improves posture
Helps prevent gestational diabetes and pregnancy-induced hypertension
Manages weight gain within healthy ranges
Improves sleep quality and reduces insomnia
Boosts mood and reduces pregnancy-related anxiety
Increases energy levels and reduces fatigue
Prepares muscles for labor and delivery
Promotes faster postpartum recovery

sections.title: Benefits for Your Baby
sections.content: Your activity level positively impacts your baby's development:
points: Promotes healthy placental development and function
May contribute to healthier birth weights
Supports optimal fetal growth patterns
Can lead to better stress tolerance in newborns
May enhance neurodevelopmental outcomes
Creates healthy patterns that can continue postpartum

sections.title: Safe Exercise Practices
points: Aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate activity weekly
Include both cardiovascular and strength training exercises
Stay hydrated and avoid overheating during workouts
Wear supportive footwear and comfortable clothing
Listen to your body and adjust intensity as needed
Consult your healthcare provider before starting new activities
